intro: Turraea cuneata, commonly known as the African butter tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its large, palm-like leaves and clusters of yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces a milky latex sap that has been traditionally used for various medicinal purposes. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
